sources.description: In this drama, based on a true story, Allied prisoners of war plan a mass escape from a highly secure prison camp during World War II. Under the guidance of British officers, they build three tunnels for this purpose. Tensions repeatedly arise within the heterogeneous group.. Even after the escape, the men face a long, dangerous journey ahead. With an excellent cast and expert direction, this groundbreaking escape film develops elaborate suspense sequences, with contemporary history serving primarily as a backdrop.

metadata.Plot: Based on a true story, a group of allied escape artist-type prisoners-of-war are all put in an "escape proof" camp. Their leader decides to try to take out several hundred all at once. The first half of the movie is played for comedy, as the prisoners mostly outwit their jailers to dig the escape tunnel. The second half is high adventure as they use planes, trains, and boats to get out of occupied Europe.
metadata.Writer: Paul Brickhill, James Clavell, W.R. Burnett
metadata.Actors: Steve McQueen, James Garner, Richard Attenborough
metadata.Awards: Nominated for 1 Oscar. 3 wins & 12 nominations total
